title: Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry code assist
description:
Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)

Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature is consuming too much code in a specific scenario. This issue can be replicated by following the steps provided in the description.
EB: The expected behavior is that the code assist feature should stop consuming code at the correct position. In this case, it should stop after the first 'foo()' method call, resulting in the code 'baz(x.foo()x.foo())'.
SR:
1. Open the provided class 'X'.
2. Locate the 'bar' method.
3. Add a parameter to the 'baz' method call in the 'bar' method.
4. Save the changes and observe the code assist feature.
